Title: Nikkiso to provide regasification equipment for LNG-to-power project in the Bahamas
Description: Japanese cryogenic solutions player Nikkiso Clean Energy & Industrial Gases Group has announced that it was contracted by Shell-FOCOL joint venture NPG to provide LNG regasification and cryogenic equipment for the New Providence Gas Project in Nassau, the Bahamas.
Author: JS

Title: Tohoku Electric’s Onagawa Unit 2 to shut down for preventive maintenance
Description: Japanese utility Tohoku Electric Power’s 825 MW Onagawa Nuclear Power Station Unit 2 is scheduled to shut down for 10 days from Aug. 21 for preventive maintenance, including the replacement of four hydrogen concentration detectors.
Author: CK

Title: Gunvor to offtake 0.85 mtpa of LNG from Amigo LNG
Description: Mexico-based LNG project developed Amigo LNG has signed a sales and purchase agreement (SPA) with global energy trader Gunvor for it to offtake 0.85 mtpa of LNG for 20 years, commencing in the second half of 2028.
Author: JS

Title: Santos takeover talks continue as Adnoc unit-led consortium delays binding agreement
Description: Discussions over a non-binding $18.7 billion takeover of Australian gas producer Santos by a consortium led by Abu Dhabi National Oil Co.’s subsidiary XRG are ongoing, but the parties are unlikely to meet the current Aug. 22 exclusivity deadline for a binding agreement.
Author: CK

Title: Japan’s NYK delivers third LNG ship to QatarEnergy as part of  fleet expansion programme
Description: Japanese shipper NYK has delivered the 174,000 m3 Al Zuwair LNG tanker to QatarEnergy, marking another step in the state-owned company’s massive newbuilding program to support its North Field LNG expansion project.
Author: CK

Title: NWS Project Extension consultations continue as Karratha Gas Plant ullage rises
Description: Woodside and its North West Shelf joint venture partners are continuing consultations with the Australian Government on proposed conditions for the NWS Project Extension, which will support long-term operations and processing of future third-party gas at Australia's oldest and largest LNG plant.
Author: CK

Title: Hammerfest LNG faces six-day shipment gap following brief unplanned outage
Description: Norway’s 4.2 mtpa Hammerfest LNG plant on Melkoya Island faces a six-day gap in exports, following an unplanned three-day outage and the departure of its most recent cargo on Aug. 18.
Author: CK
